qas.question: Where did the Greeks established their trading colonies?
Which coast did the Carthaginians explore for trade?
Who would raid the desert leaving the people in constant   fear?

plausible_answers.text: turbulence of the waters and the lack of markets

qas.question: What made the areas south of Morocco ideal for settlement?

plausible_answers.text: the Atlantic coast of the desert

qas.question: What area did the Berber people colonize?

plausible_answers.text: those living on the edge of the desert

qas.question: Who was responsible for the raids on the Berber people?
Who established trading colonies along the Atlantic?
When did the Greeks abandon the desert?

context: By <b7_0>500 BCE<b7_0/>, Greeks arrived in the desert. <b6_0>Greek traders<b6_0/> spread along the eastern coast of the desert, establishing trading colonies along the <a0_0>Red Sea<a0_0/>. The Carthaginians explored <a1_0><b4_0>the Atlantic coast<a1_0/> of the desert<b4_0/>, but the <b3_0>turbulence of the waters and the lack of markets<b3_0/> caused a lack of presence further south than modern Morocco. Centralized states thus surrounded the desert on the north and east; it remained outside the control of these states. Raids from the <a2_0>nomadic Berber<a2_0/> people of the desert were a constant concern of <b5_0>those living on the edge of the desert<b5_0/>.
